Delimiter.description: A single character that specifies the delimiter being used in the CSV file.

HeaderRow.description: A variable that specifies whether the first row in the file is parsed as the header. If this value is false, column names are auto-generated.

CsvOptions.description: Represents a set of options that define how DataBrew will read a comma-separated value (CSV) file when creating a dataset from that file.

CatalogId.description: The unique identifier of the AWS account that holds the Data Catalog that stores the data.

DatabaseName.description: The name of a database in the Data Catalog.

TableName.description: The name of a database table in the Data Catalog. This table corresponds to a DataBrew dataset.

TempDirectory.description: An Amazon location that AWS Glue Data Catalog can use as a temporary directory.

DataCatalogInputDefinition.description: Represents how metadata stored in the AWS Glue Data Catalog is defined in a DataBrew dataset.

DatabaseTableName.description: The table within the target database.

GlueConnectionName.description: The AWS Glue Connection that stores the connection information for the target database.

QueryString.description: Custom SQL to run against the provided AWS Glue connection. This SQL will be used as the input for DataBrew projects and jobs.

TempDirectory.description: An Amazon location that AWS Glue Data Catalog can use as a temporary directory.

DatabaseInputDefinition.description: Connection information for dataset input files stored in a database.

CreateColumn.description: Optional boolean value that defines whether the captured value of this parameter should be loaded as an additional column in the dataset.

DatetimeOptions.description: Additional parameter options such as a format and a timezone. Required for datetime parameters.

Filter.description: The optional filter expression structure to apply additional matching criteria to the parameter.

Name.description: The name of the parameter that is used in the dataset's Amazon S3 path.

Type.description: The type of the dataset parameter, can be one of a 'String', 'Number' or 'Datetime'.

DatasetParameter.description: Represents a dataset paramater that defines type and conditions for a parameter in the Amazon S3 path of the dataset.

Format.description: Required option, that defines the datetime format used for a date parameter in the Amazon S3 path. Should use only supported datetime specifiers and separation characters, all litera a-z or A-Z character should be escaped with single quotes. E.g. "MM.dd.yyyy-'at'-HH:mm".

LocaleCode.description: Optional value for a non-US locale code, needed for correct interpretation of some date formats.

TimezoneOffset.description: Optional value for a timezone offset of the datetime parameter value in the Amazon S3 path. Shouldn't be used if Format for this parameter includes timezone fields. If no offset specified, UTC is assumed.

DatetimeOptions.description: Represents additional options for correct interpretation of datetime parameters used in the Amazon S3 path of a dataset.

HeaderRow.description: A variable that specifies whether the first row in the file is parsed as the header. If this value is false, column names are auto-generated.

SheetIndexes.description: One or more sheet numbers in the Excel file that will be included in the dataset.

SheetNames.description: One or more named sheets in the Excel file that will be included in the dataset.

ExcelOptions.description: Represents a set of options that define how DataBrew will interpret a Microsoft Excel file when creating a dataset from that file.

MaxFiles.description: The number of Amazon S3 files to select.

Order.description: A criteria to use for Amazon S3 files sorting before their selection. By default uses DESCENDING order, i.e. most recent files are selected first. Anotherpossible value is ASCENDING.

OrderedBy.description: A criteria to use for Amazon S3 files sorting before their selection. By default uses LAST_MODIFIED_DATE as a sorting criteria. Currently it's the only allowed value.

FilesLimit.description: Represents a limit imposed on number of Amazon S3 files that should be selected for a dataset from a connected Amazon S3 path.

Expression.description: The expression which includes condition names followed by substitution variables, possibly grouped and combined with other conditions. For example, "(starts_with :prefix1 or starts_with :prefix2) and (ends_with :suffix1 or ends_with :suffix2)". Substitution variables should start with ':' symbol.

ValuesMap.description: The map of substitution variable names to their values used in this filter expression.

FilterExpression.description: Represents a structure for defining parameter conditions.

Value.description: The value to be associated with the substitution variable.

FilterValue.description: Represents a single entry in the `ValuesMap` of a `FilterExpression` . A `FilterValue` associates the name of a substitution variable in an expression to its value.

Csv.description: Options that define how CSV input is to be interpreted by DataBrew.

Excel.description: Options that define how Excel input is to be interpreted by DataBrew.

Json.description: Options that define how JSON input is to be interpreted by DataBrew.

FormatOptions.description: Represents a set of options that define the structure of either comma-separated value (CSV), Excel, or JSON input.

DataCatalogInputDefinition.description: The AWS Glue Data Catalog parameters for the data.

DatabaseInputDefinition.description: Connection information for dataset input files stored in a database.

Metadata.description: Contains additional resource information needed for specific datasets.

S3InputDefinition.description: The Amazon S3 location where the data is stored.

Input.description: Represents information on how DataBrew can find data, in either the AWS Glue Data Catalog or Amazon S3.

MultiLine.description: A value that specifies whether JSON input contains embedded new line characters.

JsonOptions.description: Represents the JSON-specific options that define how input is to be interpreted by AWS Glue DataBrew .

SourceArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) associated with the dataset. Currently, DataBrew only supports ARNs from Amazon AppFlow.

Metadata.description: Contains additional resource information needed for specific datasets.

FilesLimit.description: If provided, this structure imposes a limit on a number of files that should be selected.

LastModifiedDateCondition.description: If provided, this structure defines a date range for matching Amazon S3 objects based on their LastModifiedDate attribute in Amazon S3 .

Parameters.description: A structure that maps names of parameters used in the Amazon S3 path of a dataset to their definitions.

PathOptions.description: Represents a set of options that define how DataBrew selects files for a given Amazon S3 path in a dataset.

PathParameterName.description: The name of the path parameter.

PathParameter.description: Represents a single entry in the path parameters of a dataset. Each `PathParameter` consists of a name and a parameter definition.

BucketOwner.description: The AWS account ID of the bucket owner.

Key.description: The unique name of the object in the bucket.

S3Location.description: Represents an Amazon S3 location (bucket name, bucket owner, and object key) where DataBrew can read input data, or write output from a job.

Format.description: The file format of a dataset that is created from an Amazon S3 file or folder.

FormatOptions.description: A set of options that define how DataBrew interprets the data in the dataset.

Input.description: Information on how DataBrew can find the dataset, in either the AWS Glue Data Catalog or Amazon S3 .

Name.description: The unique name of the dataset.

PathOptions.description: A set of options that defines how DataBrew interprets an Amazon S3 path of the dataset.

Source.description: The location of the data for the dataset, either Amazon S3 or the AWS Glue Data Catalog .

Tags.description: Metadata tags that have been applied to the dataset.
